Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: @Decker hey mate, can you please tell me how are you keeping the QT wallet updated with real time updates from blockchain data?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: _I haven't actually tried QT, but I assume it behaves exactly as Bitcoin QT wallet _

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
As I know the core daemon has zmq, 
are you using that in QT wallet ?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
I want a way to have realtime update from the wallet, pushed to the front-end code.
so I see few possibilities using go as backend and react.js as front-end
- use zmq to get the update on new block/tx and when it sends this update trigger the RPC API calls
- or make a code to process the debug.log file, and use it's realtime updates to trigger events to the go which passes to the front-end react.js code.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: which way you suggest?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: @Decker @pbca26 @ca333

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
the reason is this time I don't want to use `interval` push/pull method to get updates from the wallet and then do action.
I want to follow the event driven method of development with next app I'm working

Author: Decker#3767
Content: @grewalsatinder don't clearly understand the meaning of the question. Komodo-Qt is not external GUI on komodod, it's Bitcoin Core Qt Interface + Komodo Daemon inside. So, it has updates from blockchain data same way as komodod. And GUI part is used for visualisation. It's not used ZMQ or any other interface to interact with "daemon", it has "daemon inside". So, Komodo-Qt = closed integration of GUI and komodod, same as bitcoind and Bitcoin Core GUI.

Author: Decker#3767
Content: But i think for your purposes to get real-time updates from daemon in "external app" you can somehow use ZMQ or blocknotify ... but i never deep in how ZMQ works, so, can't advice anything concrete.

Author: pbca26#5430
Content:
^ either that or watch debug.log/stdout
bitcoin has an option to output everything to a console, -printtoconsole

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
@Decker okay, thanks for clearing.
@pbca26 in agama do you always do native `komodo-cli` command ? I tagged you as I thought you might be also doing something realtime in agama ü§î

Content: for native wallets

Author: Mylo#8306
Mylo#8306
Content: it's just how app devs and front end devs think - on system changes and reacting to them

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: everything happens on a block being received, just grab the relevant info with a blocknotify, blocknotify can be written in C or anything you want.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the native deamon will call the executable you specify on a block being received, check for condition

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: nothing happens if block isnt mined.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: sending a tx to mempool happens before the block, and you don't want to be polling for mempool info - it's inefficient compared to an event system that would fire off a 'mempoolTxReceiveEvent'

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: apps won't be realtime waiting up to 60s for block.  can have a to-be-confirmed state and offer realtime-ness.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: hmmm... then we need to add mempool notify, but what if somebody spams the network?
